content: marker k1 ssk k to marker repeat rnds 2 3 to shape the gusset cont in this way decreasing by 2 sts at the gusset on every other round until there are 40 44 48 52 sts on the needle once you have reached the required number of sts cont to k each round until you reach 5cm before the desired length ready to start the toes don t be afraid to try your sock on before decreasing for the toes toes note at some point while decreasing for the toes if you are using a short circular needle you may need to change back to dpns or use the magic loop method as the number of sts becomes too small for the circular it s up to you when you choose to do that and how you distribute the sts across the needles just keep following the pattern as set below create the toes as follows round 1 k1 ssk k14 16 18 20 k2tog k1 place marker if required k1 ssk k14 16 18 20 k2tog k1 36 40 44 48 sts rnds 2 3 k to end slipping markers as you come to them rnds 4 k1 ssk k12 14 16 18 k2tog k1 slip marker k1 ssk k12 14 16 18 k2tog k1 32 36 40 44 sts rnds 5 6 k to end slipping markers as you come to them round 7 k1 ssk k to 3 sts before marker k2tog k1 slip marker k1 ssk k to 3 sts before marker k2tog k1 28 32 36 40 sts round 8 k one round slipping markers as you come to them repeat rnds 7 8 another 0 1 1 2 times more 28 28 32 32 sts divide these between two needles so that front and back of socks match graft toes using kitchener stitch weave in all ends and sew up the small gap at the cuff where you cast on 3 2nd size 3rd size 4th size key 4 5 follow us join our facebook community wys crafter s hub wys1000332 5 053682 006018 2 airedale park royd ings avenue keighley west yorkshire bd21 4dg +44 0 1535 664500 sales@wyspinners com wyspinners com 42 10
